body:
The error came from a third party module instead of Electron, I don't think it is actually related to Electron:

```
80438 error Windows_NT 6.3.9600
80439 error argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install"
80440 error node v4.4.5
80441 error npm  v2.15.5
80442 error code ELIFECYCLE
80443 error extremo@6.5.47 postinstall: `npm rebuild --fallback-to-build --runtime=electron --target=1.1.2 --arch=x64 --dist-url=https://atom.io/download/atom-shell --build-from-source`
80443 error Exit status 1
80444 error Failed at the extremo@6.5.47 postinstall script 'npm rebuild --fallback-to-build --runtime=electron --target=1.1.2 --arch=x64 --dist-url=https://atom.io/download/atom-shell --build-from-source'.
80444 error This is most likely a problem with the extremo package,
80444 error not with npm itself.
80444 error Tell the author that this fails on your system:
80444 error     npm rebuild --fallback-to-build --runtime=electron --target=1.1.2 --arch=x64 --dist-url=https://atom.io/download/atom-shell --build-from-source
80444 error You can get information on how to open an issue for this project with:
80444 error     npm bugs extremo
80444 error Or if that isn't available, you can get their info via:
80444 error
80444 error     npm owner ls extremo
80444 error There is likely additional logging output above.
80445 verbose exit [ 1, true ]
```
